info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 2:21AM MDT until April 28 at 4:00AM MDT by NWS Billings MT
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following county, northeast Carter.
* WHEN...Until 400 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and along small creeks, streams, and normally dry coulees. Water was reported to be flowing over highway 323 earlier tonight.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 213 AM MDT, the public reported flooding and heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms earlier tonight. Radar estimates between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen in the advisory area since last evening. Flooding of small streams and poor drainage areas is likely ongoing. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Speelmon Creek, North Slick Creek, Boxelder Creek, Middle Slick Creek, Spring Creek, Snow Creek, Big Ramme Creek, Little Ramme Creek, Harmon Creek and Coal Creek.
Flooding impacts will continue for a few more hours as water subsides, but no additional rainfall is expected in the near term. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mainly rural areas of Northeast Carter County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING
